titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Women's Advancement Initiative records ARCH079
titlestmt.author: Transcribed to ArchivesSpace from word document finding aid by Sean Parke in Dec. 2015. Acc. 2011.22 revised in ArchivesSpace by Tiffany Crawford and Sean Parke 2016.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-06-15 11:40:02 -0400.

repository.corpname: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

did.unittitle: Women's Advancement Initiative records

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: University of Hartford. Women's Advancement Initiative

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection may be protected by copyright law (U.S. Code: Title 17). Any use of the material which exceeds fair use requires permission from the copyright holder. Researchers are solely responsible for obtaining the proper permission(s) for their use of the material.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: When Hartford College for Women phased out its undergraduate program, its funds were transferred to a new entity, eventually called "The Women's Education and Leadership Fund, a Legacy of Hartford College for Women." Jennifer Sanborn became the first director in 2005. She was later joined by a second staff member Donna Haighitah. Jennifer Sanborn left the University to assume a position at Mount Holyoke in 2011.
The WELFund changed its name in the fall of 2015 to the Women's Advancement Initiative.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The majority of the collection pertains to the programs offered or funded by the Women's Advancement Initiative.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by accession.

controlaccess.subject: Women -- Education (Higher) -- United States
controlaccess.corpname: University of Hartford. Women's Advancement Initiative
University of Hartford. Women's Education and Leadership Fund

did.unittitle: Acc. 2011.22 (WELFund records)

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Reprocessed by Tiffany Crawford in 2015-2016, under the supervision of Sean Parke. Original processor unknown.

The original chronological order has been retained for the project files. The files are arranged by the date the grant was received by the applicant. Some projects continued over the course of more than one year.

During reprocessing series were created that appeared to be the intent of the creator or original processor, with the exception of the Laura Johnson Initiative files, which were merged with the Events, Programs, and Annual Reports series.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: This first components of this collection came to the archives from the Welfund office in 2011. Additional material was added afterwards.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The accession is arranged into three series:

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Projects series is arranged in chronological order by the year in which the project started, and then arranged alphabetically by the grant recipient's last name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of photographs of a 50th class reunion [Class of 1964?], and older photographs identified by the members of that reunion.
